Attack helicopter of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns.| |Primary armament: four S-13 rocket launchers, 12.7-mm “Corde-A” heavy machine gun.|Secondary armament: two “Charybdis” anti-ship missile launchers.
Attack helicopter of the Crimson Dawn.| |Primary armament: two 30-mm APChS automatic cannons.|Secondary armament: two “Naga” guided missile launchers.

Small patrol boat of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns - “Mouette”.| |Primary armament: two “Corde” heavy machine guns.|Secondary armament: none.| |Retrofit: replacement of one of the machine guns with a “Cordage-80” multiple launch rocket system.
Small patrol boat of the Crimson Dawn - “Reaver”.| |Primary armament: two 20-mm “Birkigt” automatic cannons in a turret mount.|Secondary armament: PKT heavy machine gun.
Torpedo boat of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns - “Murene”.| |Primary armament: 533-mm STL-2 torpedo launcher.|Secondary armament: two “Corde” heavy machine guns.

Destroyer of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns - “Lyon”.| |Primary armament: two 533-mm torpedo launchers, three 130-mm guns in three single gun turrets.|Secondary armament: none.|Anti-aircraft guns: four.| |Retrofit: replacement of the primary armament with single 138-mm gun turrets, modernization of the torpedo launchers reloading system, improvement of mobility parameters.

Destroyer of the Crimson Dawn - “Albedo”.| |Primary armament: two 610-mm torpedo launchers, eight 127-mm guns in four twin gun turrets.|Secondary armament: none.|Anti-aircraft guns: three.| |Retrofit: replacement of the primary armament with twin 135-mm gun turrets, armor reinforcement.

Cruiser of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns - “Egale”.| |Primary armament: four 152-mm guns in two twin gun turrets.|Secondary armament: eight 130-mm guns (four in single gun turrets, four in sponson mounts).|Anti-aircraft guns: five.| |Retrofit: replacement of the primary armament with triple 155-mm gun turrets, installation of six 533-mm STL-1 torpedo tubes, imrpovement of mobility parameters, armor reinforcement.
Cruiser of the Crimson Dawn - “Furia”.| |Primary armament: four 203-mm twin gun turrets.|Secondary armament: four 610-mm torpedo launchers.|Anti-aircraft guns: ten.

Battleship of the Crimson Dawn - “Leviatan”.| |Primary armament: four 356-mm twin gun turrets.|Secondary armament: four 127-mm twin gun turrets.|Anti-aircraft guns: nine.| |Retrofit: replacement of the primary armament with 406-mm triple gun turrets, armor reinforcement.

Battleship of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns - “Librium”.| |Primary armament: three 406-mm triple gun turrets.|Secondary armament: eight 130-mm single gun turrets.|Anti-aircraft guns: eighteen.| |Retrofit: replacement of the primary armament with 380-mm quadruple gun turrets.
Cargo ship of the Trade Association.| |Unarmed.
Armored reconnaissance vehicle of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns - “Varan”.| |Primary armament: KPVT heavy machine gun in a turret mount.|Secondary armament: none.
Armored reconnaissance vehicle of the Crimson Dawn - “Escorpion”.| |Primary armament: two 20-mm “Birkigt” automatic cannons in a turret mount.|Secondary armament: PKT heavy machine gun.
Old model of a twin machine gun mount of the Commonwealth of Indepedent Towns. Mainly used in anti-aircraft role on CIT warships.| |Ammunition: 12.7-mm (CIT).
47-mm cannon of the Trade Association. Mainly used in anti-aircraft role on CIT and CD warships.| |Ammunition: 47-mm HE (TA).

Multi-purpose missile launcher of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Used as primary armament of CIT reconnaissance vehicles and in anti-aircraft role on CIT warships.| |Ammunition: SAM 120-mm (CIT).

Multi-purpose missile launcher of the Crimson Dawn. Used as primary armament of CD reconnaissance vehicles and patrol boats, as well as in anti-aircraft role on CD warships.| |Ammunition: ATGM 152-mm (CD).
23-mm quadruple autocannon mount of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Mainly used in anti-aircraft role on CIT battleships.| |Ammunition: 23-mm HEI (CIT).
“Cordage-80” multiple rocket launch system of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Used as primary and secondary armament of CIT patrol boats.| |Ammunition: 80-mm RHE “Cordage” (CIT).

Heavy machine gun of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Used as primary and secondary armament of CIT patrol boats and reconnaissance vehicles, as well as in anti-aircraft role on CIT warships.| |Ammunition: 12.7-mm (CIT).
Multi-purpose missile launcher of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Used as secondary armament of CIT patrol boats and in anti-aircraft role on CIT warships.| |Ammunition: SAM 72-mm (CIT).
20-mm twin autocannon mount of the Crimson Dawn. Used as primary armament of CD patrol boats and reconnaissance vehicles.| |Ammunition: 20-mm HEI (CD).
Heavy machine gun of the Crimson Dawn. Used as secondary armament of CD reconnaissance vehicles and patrol boats, as well as in anti-aircraft role on CD warships.| |Ammunition: 12.7-mm (CD).
Multi-purpose missile launcher of the Crimson Dawn. Used as secondary armament of CD patrol boats and in anti-aircraft role on CD warships.| |Ammunition: ATGM 152-mm (CD).

130-mm single gun turret the Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Used as primary armament of CIT destroyers and secondary armament of CIT cruisers and battleships.| |Ammunition: 130-mm HE (CIT), 130-mm AP (CIT).
138-mm single gun turret the Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Used as primary armament of modernized CIT destroyers.| |Ammunition: 138-mm HE (CIT), 138-mm AP (CIT).
127-mm twin gun turret of the Crimson Dawn. Used as primary armament of CD destroyers and secondary armament of CD battleships.| |Ammunition: 127-mm HE (CD), 127-mm AP (CD).
135-mm twin gun turret of the Crimson Dawn. Used as primary armament of modernized CD destroyers.| |Ammunition: 135-mm HE (CD), 135-mm AP (CD).
152-mm twin gun turret of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Used as primary armament of CIT cruisers.| |Ammunition: 152-mm HE (CIT), 152-mm AP (CIT).
155-mm triple gun turret of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Used as primary armament of modernized CIT cruisers.| |Ammunition: 155-mm HE (CIT), 155-mm AP (CIT).
152-mm triple gun turret of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Used as primary armament of CIT heavy cruisers and coastal artillery guns.| |Ammunition: 152-mm HE (CIT), 152-mm AP (CIT).
203-mm twin gun turret of the Crimson Dawn. Used as primary armament of CD cruisers and coastal artillery guns.| |Ammunition: 203-mm HE (CD), 203-mm AP (CD).
406-mm triple gun turret of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Used as primary armament of CIT battleships and heavy coastal artillery guns.| |Ammunition: 406-mm HE (CIT), 406-mm AP (CIT).
380-mm quadruple gun turret of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Used as primary armament of modernized CIT battleships.| |Ammunition: 380-mm HE (CIT), 380-mm AP (CIT).
457-mm triple gun turret of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Used as primary armament of the CIT Atlantic fleet flagship.| |Ammunition: 457-mm HE (CIT), 457-mm AP (CIT).
130-mm twin gun turret of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Used as secondary armament of the CIT Atlantic fleet flagship.| |Ammunition: 130-mm HE (CIT), 130-mm AP (CIT).
356-mm twin gun turret of the Crimson Dawn. Used as primary armament of CD battleships.| |Ammunition: 356-mm HE (CD), 356-mm AP (CD), 356-mm AA (CD).
406-mm triple gun turret of the Crimson Dawn. Used as primary armament of modernized CD battleships.| |Ammunition: 406-mm HE (CD), 406-mm AP (CD).
Heavy machine gun of the Commonwealth of Independent Towns in a turret mount. Used as primary armament of CIT reconnaissance vehicles.| |Ammunition: 14.5-mm (CIT).
Potatoes it is. What else is there to be said? The main source of food for all people.
Sometimes you can make good truck spare parts out of the scraps of rusty metal. Some people also say that someone has learned how to melt rusty metal into steel ingots.
Wood has always been a source of warmth. Both as a fuel and as a cheap building material.
Whoever controls oil also controls transportation. Therefore, there is much intrigue surrounding this valuable commodity.
Replacement parts of mechanisms that no mechanic can do without.
A piece of multicolored glass jewelry brings good luck and attracts money. The larger the piece, the higher the value.
High-octane fuel is very rare and comes at a considerable premium.
Houses made of processed wood are stronger and warmer than shacks and huts.
Sometimes miners manage to dig up entire aggregates that look like they could be operational. With proper skill, they can be used to create truly valuable machinery.
It is unknown what was done in the past with these smelly sticks, but today they are actively used as an ingredient for remedies.
Old books. Few people today can read, but those who can, are willing to pay good money for the wisdom of the ages hidden among the yellowing pages.
The most advanced models of machines need delicate high-tech components. It's scary to think what will happen when the deposits of electronics run out.
